Our critic's picks of the week's top shows

Elizabeth Kramer, ekramer@courier-journal.com 11:36 a.m. EST November 21, 2014

Chase Rice(Photo: Promotional photo)

CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE


SUNDAY

Johannes String Quartet. Part of the Chamber Music Society of Louisville Concert Series. 3 p.m., Comstock Concert Hall, University of Louisville School of Music, First Street and Brandeis Avenue. $25, $5 for students. (502) 852-6907.

University of Louisville Chorus, Collegiate Chorale & Cardinal Singers. 7:30 p.m., Comstock Concert Hall, University of Louisville School of Music, First Street and Brandeis Avenue. Free.

Voces Novae. "Birth The Journey Begins." 3 p.m., Church of the Ascension, 4600 Lynnbrook Drive. Tickets available at the door. $16, $14 seniors, $8 students. voces-novae.org.

Indiana University Southeast Orchestra. 3 p.m., Stem Concert Hall, Ogle Cultural and Community Center, 4201 Grant Line Road, New Albany. $10, $8, seniors, $5 for students. (812) 941-2526.

COURIER-JOURNAL

Critic's pick | Performing arts

MONDAY

University of Louisville Jazz Repertory Ensembles. 7 p.m., Bird Recital Hall, University of Louisville School of Music, First Street and Brandeis Avenue. Free.

University of Louisville Brass Ensembles. 8 p.m., Comstock Concert Hall, University of Louisville School of Music, First Street and Brandeis Avenue. Free.

“Mythbusters”: Jamie Hyneman, left, and Adam Savage(Photo: Provided)

TUESDAY

Cardinal Rule. 8 p.m., Comstock Concert Hall, University of Louisville School of Music, First Street and Brandeis Avenue. Free.

"Mythbusters — Behind the Myths Tour." With Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman, co-hosts of the Emmy-nominated Discovery Channel series "Mythbusters." 7:30 p.m., Whitney Hall, 501 W. Main St. $38-$67. (502) 584-7777.

Jeff Sherman. Jazz concert with his students. 7 p.m., Varanese Restaurant, 2106 Frankfort Ave. Reservation are requested. Free. (502) 899-9904.

FRIDAY

Louisville Orchestra. "King Southern Bank Holiday Spectacular." 7:30 p.m., Brown Theatre, 315 W. Broadway. $15 and $30. (502) 584-7777.

"A World War II Radio Christmas." The holiday show re-creates the experience of attending a recording of a 1940s radio broadcast on Christmas Eve during World War II. Presented by Hayswood Theatre. Friday and Saturday, 8 p.m., 115 S. Capitol Avenue, Corydon. Ends Dec. 14. $14, $12 for seniors and ages 17 and younger. (812) 738-2138.

SATURDAY

Chase Rice: Ignite the Night Tour. 8 p.m., Mercury Ballroom, 611 S. 4th St. $20. mercuryballroom.com.

"The Twelve Murders of Christmas." Six strangers are invited to a lavish holiday soiree only to discover that they are locked in for the night and one of them is intent on murdering the others. Presented by WhoDunnit Murder Mystery Dinner Theatre. Saturdays, 7 p.m., Hilton Garden Inn-Airport, 2735 Crittenden Drive. Ends Jan. 3. $45.50 includes dinner, show, tax and gratuity. (502) 426-7100.

Bourbon Baroque, Youth Performing Arts School Chamber Choir. "Handel's Messiah." Emily Albrink Katz, soprano; Audrey Walstrom, mezzo-soprano; Steven Paul Spears, tenor and Jim Rittenhouse, baritone. Saturday, 7:30 p.m.; next Sunday, 2 p.m., St. Brigid Catholic Church, 1520 Hepburn Ave. $20, free for ages 18 and younger for next Sunday's performance. Tickets available at the door. (502) 614-7178.

Louisville Orchestra. "Home for the Holidays." Part of the orKIDStra Series. 11 a.m., Brown Theatre, 315 W. Broadway. $15. (502) 584-7777.

Send information about arts events and exhibits to listings@courier-journal.com. The deadline for the Dec. 7 Arts section is Friday.
